Richard de la Mare, Chairman. P. F. du Sautoy, Vice-Chairman
Lady Faber, T. S. Eliot, Morley Kennerley (u.s.A.), Alan Pringle, David Bland, Charles Monteith, Peter Crawley
FABER AMD FABER LTD

1U April 196U
Mr James A, Fellows,
National Association of Educational Broadcasters,
13U6 Connecticut Avenue,
Washington 36, D.C.
U.S.A.
Dear Mr Fellows,
Thank you for your letter of 27 March concerning the
broadcast of Marianne Mooreâ€™s poem ''Silence" from her COLLECTED
POEMS. We are quite agreeable to this, but feel that it would
not be unreasonable to ask a fee of 2 guineas for the use of
the poem, and I am accordingly enclosing our invoice for this
amount.
Yours sincerely.
Stephanie Wood
Permissions Department
